result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for consolidation of criminal charges

records.addlTxt: Received a Request to Adjourn Status Conference from 8/17/15 to 9/14/15 from Attorney Osborne on 8/12/15.  Oversight in requesting approval from DA office until 8/17/15.  DA office approves.  Judge office approves.  Status moved to 9/14/15.

This bond covers 15CF12, 14CM264, & 13CM428:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  Z.F.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Faxed NOH and sig bond to Monroe County Jail per their direction at (608)269-2164

Pre-trial conference at 07-01-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 07-20-2015 03:00 pm.

Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person in custody with attorney Robert Osborne.  Warrant is quashed in 15CF12 and 14CM264.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  Judge reviews charges and potential penalties.  Defendant understands.  Attorney Osborne requests to address bond; states his client has been in custody in Monroe County since December 15, 2014 on a $2500 cash bond;  feels no additional cash bond is needed.  DA Fox requests conditions of bond:  All no alcohol conditions and no contact with Z.F.  Court sets $5000 signature bond on 15CF12, 14CM264, & 13CM428 with conditions of:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  Z.F.  Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing, requests pretrial and status dates.  Court reviews right to PH and time limits; accepts waiver of time limits to prelim.  Pre-trial set for 7-1-15 at 10:00 and status set with other 2 cases for 7-20-15 at 3:00.
